column4: its probably a very simple problem.. or not a problem at all... but im used to just start ubunto and then it boots up..... Can anyone just tell me how i boot my system up again? .. I have nothing special. Only a partition with Ubuntu.. no windows or anything on that machine..

i got a problem :( my ubuntu has been up and running for 40 days.. when i restarted it now (the update package utility installed a new kernel a while ago) it wont boot now.. i come to a grub> prompt.. its the boot loader but how do i get it to boot? :(
boot into the old kernel? if you still can
yes, but how do i do that? .. im in the grub> prompt and cant boot the system.. and im a n00b :)
does any other kernel options come up?
see my message to locomorto above...
I know wha tyou say but once you reboot
i guess this is the bootloader and i just have to tell it from where it is supposed to boot..
I'll tell you how to do it
ok..
do you know what kernel you have?
no :(
these are the commands that need to be edited
i know that i have the hoary dist and that there was a kernel update via the update utility a while ago... the only kernel update i have seen..
root            (hd2,1)
if i typ root it says "(hd0,0): filesystem type is ext2fs, partition type 0x83"
ok
kernel          /vmlinuz-2.6.10-5-386 root=/dev/sda3 ro single
then initrd          /initrd.img-2.6.10-5-386
then boot
'initrd /initrd.img-2.6.10-5-386'
yes, i only have one hdd in my comp.. and only with ubuntu on the comp...
oh ok
so shall i enter the settings you typed?
then root (hd0,0)
yes, that is already set right..
but i need something for kernel and something for initrd
initrd /initrd.img-2.6.10-5-386
need kernel first..
kernel          /vmlinuz-2.6.10-5-386 root=/dev/hda1 ro single
ok.. hold on..
its ata
i think its hda1.. ?
im typing.. hold on :)
it says "error 15: file not found"
brb
ok.. when i type kernel / and press tab it says "possible files are: lost+found etc media cdrom var user........." and so on..
what kernel do you have then?
did you see my /msg i typed for you?
yeah
type this kernel /boot and keep pushing tab and maybe it'll show you what kernel you have
ok.. i dont know how to find out wich kernel i have though... but it must be the latest one provided for hoary..
ill try
well that one I gave you was my latest one
YES
it gives me different files here..
can i send it as a message to you?
well which one do you have?
yeah go for it
so shall i go for the vmlinuz-2.6.10-5-686 file?
if thats what you have yeah
and after kernel is set?.. i do what?
initrd          /initrd.img-2.6.10-5-686
grub> initrd /initrd   -> possible files are initrd initrd.img
i guess i go for "initrd /initrd.img" then?
sorry for beeing a pain in the ass ;)
when this is set? what do i do? just reboot again?
nope
just type boot
ok
did it work?
woot.. something happend... but..
but what?

it started to boot.. then a lot of text.. then the message "pivot_root: no such file or directory" [new line]  /sbin/init: 428: canot open dev/console: No such file [new line]  Kernel panic - not syncing: attemted to kill init!  [end]
what did you do to it?
an update wouldn't cause that?
i did nothing else then the updates... i did not reboot between 2 updates... but i dont know if that is nessesary..
system has been up for 40 days and been running perfect..
thats wierd
thats a major issue?
you might have to fix it with the cd
yes.. thats weird... thing is .. i have 11000 gallery images on that machine... (my whole life).. heh.. :( (nervous)
see if you can log in using the cd
you'll log in fine
i tried reboot again.. and came to the grub> again...
get a live cd and mount the hdd doing that
ok.. i want to try to get the system up though.. i have made so much settings with apache2, php, gallery and so on..
shall i try another kernel exept vmlinuz? .. what if i try /boot/initrd.img-2.6.10-5-686?
instead of using initrd /initrd.img  i used initrd /boot/initrd.img-2.6.10-5-686.. but the same fault.. cannot open dev/console...
yeah can you google that
I don't know how to get around that
google what? the fault message i get when i try to boot?
check this out.. http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=58221
more guys that has EXACTLY the same problems as me...

i gonna leave now.. but i posted the problem in a thread.. and more ppl seems to have the problem.. thanks for takeing the time to help me! i found others that have the same problem now.. so we might get to a sollution.. thx!
good luck
glad to at least help out
i might need it ;)
im happy you did.. thx! :)
anytime
